panels.description: Key performance indicators for agent operations including total operations executed, token consumption (input and output), and average response time across all agents.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend 
    input_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.input_tokens"]),
    output_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.output_tokens"])
| summarize 
    ['Total Operations'] = count(),
    ['Total Input Tokens'] = sum(input_tokens),
    ['Total Output Tokens'] = sum(output_tokens),
    ['Avg Response Time'] = round(avg(duration) / 1000, 2)

panels.title: Summary Statistics

panels.description: Time series chart showing average, 95th percentile, and 99th percentile response times for agent operations over time to monitor performance trends and identify latency issues.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| summarize 
    avg = avg(duration) / 1000,
    p95 = percentile(duration, 95) / 1000,
    p99 = percentile(duration, 99) / 1000
    by bin(timestamp, $interval)

panels.title: Agent Response Time Trends

panels.description: Percentage of successful agent operations displayed as a gauge with color-coded thresholds: red (0-90%), yellow (90-95%), green (95-100%).

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| summarize 
    success_rate = countif(success == "True") * 100.0 / count()

panels.title: Success Rate

panels.description: Number of agent operations executed per time interval, displayed as a bar chart to track system utilization and identify peak usage periods.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| summarize 
    operations_per_minute = count() 
    by bin(timestamp, $interval)

panels.title: Throughput

panels.description: Stacked time series chart showing input and output token usage trends over time, helping monitor AI model consumption and associated costs.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend 
    input_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.input_tokens"]),
    output_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.output_tokens"])
| summarize 
    ['Input Tokens'] = sum(input_tokens),
    ['Output Tokens'] = sum(output_tokens)
    by bin(timestamp, $interval)

panels.title: Token Consumption Over Time

panels.description: Donut chart showing the distribution of total token consumption (input + output) across different agents, helping identify which agents consume the most resources.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend agent_name = tostring(customDimensions["gen_ai.agent.name"])
| extend 
    input_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.input_tokens"]),
    output_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.output_tokens"])
| summarize 
    total_tokens = sum(input_tokens + output_tokens)
    by agent_name
| where isnotempty(agent_name)

panels.title: Token Usage by Agent

panels.description: Bar chart estimating daily operational costs based on token consumption and model pricing. Rates are configurable in the query (example: $1.25 per 1M input tokens, $10 per 1M output tokens).

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend 
    input_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.input_tokens"]),
    output_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.output_tokens"])
| extend 
    // Adjust these rates based on your model pricing (example: GPT-5 pricing)
    input_cost = input_tokens * 0.00000125,  // $1.25 per 1M input tokens
    output_cost = output_tokens * 0.00001    // $10 per 1M output tokens
| summarize 
    estimated_cost = sum(input_cost + output_cost)
    by bin(timestamp, 1d)
| order by timestamp asc

panels.title: Daily Cost Estimation

panels.description: Table summarizing key performance metrics for each agent including total operations, average response time, and success rate with color-coded success rate indicators.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend agent_name = tostring(customDimensions["gen_ai.agent.name"])
| where isnotempty(agent_name)
| summarize 
    operations = count(),
    avg_duration = round(avg(duration) / 1000, 2),
    success_rate = round(countif(success == "True") * 100.0 / count(), 2)
    by agent_name
| order by operations desc

panels.title: Agent Performance Summary

panels.description: State timeline visualization showing hourly agent activity levels over time, with color intensity representing operation count per hour for each agent to identify usage patterns.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend agent_name = tostring(customDimensions["gen_ai.agent.name"])
| where isnotempty(agent_name)
| summarize operations_count = count() by bin(timestamp, 1h), agent_name
| order by timestamp asc

panels.title: Agent Utilization Heatmap

panels.description: Overall error percentage displayed as a gauge with color thresholds: green (0-5%), yellow (5-10%), red (>10%) to quickly assess system health.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| summarize 
    error_rate = round(countif(success == "False") * 100.0 / count(), 2)

panels.title: Error Rate

panels.description: Time series bar chart showing error count over time to identify error patterns, spikes, and trends for proactive troubleshooting.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| where success == "False"
| summarize error_count = count() by bin(timestamp, $interval)

panels.title: Error Timeline

panels.description: Table displaying the 20 most recent failed agent operations with timestamp, agent name, error type, and duration to facilitate quick error analysis and debugging.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent" and success == "False"
| extend 
    error_type = tostring(customDimensions["error.type"]),
    agent_name = tostring(customDimensions["gen_ai.agent.name"])
| project timestamp, agent_name, error_type, duration = round(duration / 1000, 2)
| order by timestamp desc
| limit 20

panels.title: Recent Errors

panels.description: Horizontal bar chart comparing 50th, 95th, and 99th percentile response times across different agents to identify performance variations and outliers.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies 
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend agent_name = tostring(customDimensions["gen_ai.agent.name"])
| where isnotempty(agent_name)
| summarize 
    p50 = percentile(duration, 50) / 1000,
    p95 = percentile(duration, 95) / 1000,
    p99 = percentile(duration, 99) / 1000
    by agent_name

panels.title: Response Time Percentiles by Agent

azureLogAnalytics.query:
dependencies
| where name contains "invoke_agent"
| extend Agent = tostring(customDimensions["gen_ai.agent.name"])
| extend input_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.input_tokens"]), output_tokens = toint(customDimensions["gen_ai.usage.output_tokens"])
| project timestamp, Agent, duration, input_tokens, output_tokens, TraceId=operation_Id
| order by timestamp desc

list.description: Trace Id of the agent operations
list.label: Trace Id
list.name: agentTraceId

title: Agent Framework Monitoring
description: Comprehensive monitoring dashboard for Microsoft Agent Framework performance, tracking operations, token usage, costs, errors, and detailed trace analysis. Monitor your AI agents' health, response times, success rates, and resource consumption in real-time.
